column1: Impetigo is a common skin infection.
Impetigo is caused by streptococcus (strep) or staphylococcus (staph) bacteria.
Impetigo is most common in children who live in unhealthy conditions.

- Blisters that itch, are filled with yellow or honey-colored fluid, and ooze and crust over - Rash that may begin as a single spot, but spreads to other areas with scratching - Skin sores on the face, lips, arms, or legs that spread to other areas - Swollen lymph nodes near the infection - Patches of impetigo on the body (in children)
Your health care provider will look at your skin to determine if you have impetigo.
The goal of treatment is to get rid of the infection and relieve your symptoms.
